author: gian_marco_rinaldi
post: Louis, it is well known that Baruch worked in the private home of the Whangers, while Litt worked in Bonn where he was a university professor and had a specialized laboratory. Baruch used an Olympus AX 70 microscope. Litt (according to Danin) availed of interference contrast microscopy and confocal laser scanning microscopy, that is the best one could wish for this type of research. If he needed a more ordinary instrument, no doubt he could obtain one. See for example: https://www.shroud.com/pdfs/daninx.pdf http://greatshroudofturinfaq.com/Science/Pollen/Gundelia tournefortii questioned.html.
